intro: Cyanothamnus montimulliganensis, commonly known as the Montimulligan bluebush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its compact shrub form with dense, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
